Motivation

Background

Precision agriculture is an ever-growing technological field that aims to change the farming culture and technologies towards low-input, high-efficiency and sustainable agriculture. Although these are high-level goals that the technology aims to accomplish, there are important specific aims that should be noted, such as increasing the operational efficiency in the agri-food sector in general; reducing the total food waste generated worldwide, and reducing the significant environmental footprint that is caused by farming.

Developments in precision agriculture are going through a rapid growth period as the cost of sensors has greatly decreased; the ability to cost effectively store and pipeline large quantities of data has increased; and advances in machine learning and compute power has made parsing and analysing the gathered data more accessible.
